turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Philostratus.
turn.1: What is the difference between a philosopher and a sophist?
turn.2: The philosopher, as he says, investigates truth; the sophist embellishes it, and takes it for granted.
turn.4: "Gymnasticus", written after 220 AD, contains accounts concerning the Olympic games and athletic contests in general.
turn.5: Did he write any other dialogues?
turn.6: "Epistolae", or "Love Letters", breathe the spirit of the New Comedy and the Alexandrine poets; portions of Letter 33 are almost literally translated in Ben Jonson's "Song to Celia", "Drink to Me Only with Thine Eyes. " The letters are mainly of an erotic character.
turn.7: When did he write those dialogues?
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: Internal evidence confirms that the authors of "Life of Apollonius" and "Lives of the Sophists" are one and the same.
turn.11: Did he have any other dialogues?
turn.12: The "Lives of the Sophists" was to have an enormous impact upon later writers, particularly Neoplatonists.
